content.prompt:
The graph below shows the survivorship curve for bees over time.

Which of the following claims best supports the classification of bees as an organism that displays a Type II survivorship curve, as shown in the graph above?

choices.label: Queen bees are capable of laying up to 2,000 eggs in one day.
Away from the colony, bees experience a constant probability of death per unit time as a foraging species.
Bees communicate using chemical signals and exchange information through vibration of their wings.
Populations of bees are declining in North America due to habitat loss and pesticide use.

skill.text: Skill 5.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
